title: What a wonderful world.......
name: What a wonderful world.......
description:
A Map by Weemanismeman

History project!

properties.name: Albuquerque
properties.description: Posted by WeemanismemanThe city was founded in 1706 as the Spanish colonial outpost of Ranchos de Alburquerque. Present day Albuquerque retains much of the Spanish culture. Alburquerque was a farming community and a military outpost along the Camino Real. The town of Alburquerque was built in with a central plaza surrounded by government buildings, homes, and a church. This central plaza area has been preserved and is open to the public as a museum. It is referred to as "Old Town Albuquerque" or simply "Old Town."

properties.name: Denver
properties.description: Posted by WeemanismemanDenver City was founded in November of 1858 as a mining town during the Pikes Peak Gold Rush in western Kansas Territory. A group of gold prospectors from Lawrence, Kansas, arrived and made Montana City on the banks of the South Platte River. This was the first settlement in what was later to become the city of Denver. The site was abandoned in favor of Auraria and St. Charles City by the summer of 1859. The Montana City site is now Grant-Frontier Park and includes mining equipment and a log cabin replica.

properties.name: General Santos City
properties.description: Posted by WeemanismemanGeneral Santos City lies at the southern part of the Philippines. The city is southeast of Manila, southeast of Cebu and southwest of Davao. Fertile agricultural lands at over 18,000 hectares are 32 percent of the city\'s total land area. Climate is pretty nice there. It is outside of the typhoon belt and dominated by low plain areas. With evenly distributed rainfall, it is suitable for agricultural-based industries

properties.name: Las Vegas
properties.description: Posted by WeemanismemanLas Vegas started as a stopover on the pioneer trails and became a popular railroad town in the early 1900s. It was a staging point for all the mines in the surrounding area that shipped their goods out to the rest of the country. When railroads became popular, Las Vegas became less important, but when the Hoover Dam was completed, it made a lot of new growth in tourism, which led to the creation of the casino-hotels which Las Vegas is famous for

properties.name: London
properties.description: Posted by WeemanismemanLondon can be defined in a number of different ways. At London\'s core is the ancient City of London which is commonly known as \'Square Mile\'. London\'s metropolitan area grew alot during the Victorian era and again during the between the 2 world wars but expansion halted in the 1940s because of World War II. The area has stayed pretty much the same ever since. The London region of England, also known as Greater London, is the area administered by the Greater London Authority. The urban sprawl of the Greater London Urban Area covers a similar area, with little bit of a larger population.

properties.name: Paris
properties.description: Posted by WeemanismemanThe earliest signs of permanent human life in the Paris area date back to about 4200 BC. The Parisii, known as boatsmen and traders inhabited the area near the Seine River in 250 BC. The Romans conquered the Paris basin in 52 BC,with a permanent settlement by the end of the same century. Paris expanded greatly over the following centuries, becoming a prosperous city with a forum, palaces, baths, temples, and theatres. The collapse of the Roman empire and the third-century Germanic invasions sent the city into a period of decline. By 400 AD Paris was little more than a garrison town entrenched into the hastily fortified central island. At the end of the Roman Empire, Paris began to grow again and is now a large city

properties.name: Salt Lake City
properties.description: Posted by WeemanismemanThe city was founded in 1847 by a group of Mormon pioneers led by Brigham Young who fled hostility and violence in the midwest. The headquarters of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints is located in the city. Mining booms and the construction of the first transcontinental railroad brought economic growth, and the city became nicknamed the Crossroads of the West. Now, the city has developed a strong tourism industry , become the industrial banking center of the U.S, and served as host to the 2002 Winter Olympics.

properties.name: San Diego
properties.description: Posted by Weemanismeman San Diego is a costal city on the southern coast of California. It is the second largest city in Califonia, and the eighth largest in the U.S. La Jolla is a seaside resort community of up to 43,000 residents within the city of San Diego, California.

properties.name: Seattle
properties.description: Posted by WeemanismemanÂ  Seattle is consider to be the birthplace of grunge music, which was hugely popular in the 90\'s. It is also the founding city of many coffee coporations such as Starbucks and Seattle\'s best. The Space Needle, Seattle\'s largest building, was completed in 1962. It was built for the world fair. It is 605 feet tall and 138 feet wide at the base. Tourists can take elevators to get to the top. It was designated a land mark on April 19th, 1999

properties.name: St. Louis
properties.description: Posted by Weemanismeman St. Louis is the largest metropolitan city in Missouri and is named for King Louis the Ninth of France. It is nicknamed "The Gateway City" because it is seen as the Eastern/Western dividing mark in the U.S. The Gateway Arch is probably what St. Louis is most well-known for. It stands at 630 feet tall and 630 feet wide at the base. It is the tallest habitable building in St. Louis. The arch is hollow, and has an observation deck, which tourist can reach by the elevator inside.
